settings.title: The Campaign:
settings.copy:
We are excited to unveil the #PudgyChristmas Donation Challenge.
This year, we aim to donate 35,000 Pudgy toys to charitable organizations, helping to ensure that thousands of children will get to experience the excitement of finding a gift just for them.

settings.title: Your Impact:
settings.copy: Every view counts, and every share matters. For every 10,000 views on your #PudgyChristmas challenge video, we will send one of our cuddly Pudgy Penguin toys to a local charity, ready to be opened by a child on Christmas morning.

settings.title: The Why:
settings.copy:
Pudgy Penguins recognizes the challenges this year has brought to many families. With the holiday season upon us, our hearts are set on ensuring the joy of Christmas reaches as many children as possible.
While we may not reach every home, we believe our collective efforts can make the holiday season brighter for thousands of families this winter season.

settings.copy:

settings.copy: For inquiries, further information, or any questions regarding the #PudgyChristmas Donation Challenge, participants and interested parties can reach out to the campaign's official sponsor via email at spreadingjoy@pudgypenguins.io

settings.title: Use of Entries:
settings.copy: By participating in the #PudgyChristmas Donation Challenge, entrants agree to grant Pudgy Penguins the unrestricted right to use, publish, display, modify, distribute, and syndicate their submitted videos, photos, and posts across our marketing channels, including but not limited to social media platforms, websites, and promotional materials. Participation in the challenge constitutes the entrant's consent for Pudgy Penguins to use their entries for any purpose without further compensation, notification, or permission, unless prohibited by law. Entrants acknowledge that Pudgy Penguins may tag, post, repost, share, or employ the content at their discretion, ensuring participants' creativity in support of a great cause is celebrated and shared far and wide.
